Memorial Day

Monday, May 31

Memorial Day is a federal US holiday commemorating those who died in the military service for their country.

#MemorialDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

World No-Tobacco Day

Monday, May 31

This day is led by the World Health Organization to bring attention to the health issues tobacco causes, exposing industry practices, and detailing what we can do to shift the needle towards progress.

#NoTobacco (copy) View on Instagram

Details

Global Day of Parents

Tuesday, Jun 01

Created by the United Nations, June 1 is a day to show appreciation for all parents across the world.

#GlobalDayOfParents (copy) View on Instagram

Details

Leave The Office Early Day

Wednesday, Jun 02

Loved among hard workers for obvious reasons, Leave the Office Early Day is an incentive to many people who work more than 40 hours per week.

#LeaveTheOfficeEarlyDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

National Doughnut Day

Friday, Jun 04

National Doughnut Day has a link going back to 1938, when it was created by the Salvation Army to honor those who served doughnuts to soldiers during World War I. You may even find free doughnuts ‚Äì selected stores only! ‚Äì across the US and other participating countries.

#NationalDonutDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

World Environment Day

Saturday, Jun 05

Another day created by the United Nations, every June 5th celebrates World Environment Day. This day is about raising awareness and action for the global protection of the environment.

#WorldEnvironmentDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

Higher Education Day

Sunday, Jun 06

To spread awareness, this day aims to promote and educate people about the higher education path and the futures they can expect from successful study.

Details

Best Friends Day

Tuesday, Jun 08

True friends never need a particular reason to show their appreciation for each other, but Best Friends Day is a great opportunity to acknowledge genuine lifelong friendships. It was created in 1935 by the US congress to pay tribute to close friends and has been celebrated ever since.

#BestFriendsDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

World Oceans Day

Tuesday, Jun 08

This day is a chance to celebrate the beauty of our oceans and the ‚Äòlungs of our planet‚Äô ‚Äì so called because they produce most of the planet‚Äôs oxygen. It was originally proposed in 1992 by Canada‚Äôs International Centre for Ocean Development, and is an excellent chance to focus on progressive environmental issues.

#WorldOceansDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

International Children's Day

Sunday, Jun 13

Children's Day is a commemorative date celebrated annually in honor of children, whose date of observance varies by country. In 1925, International Children's Day was first proclaimed in Geneva during the World Conference on Child Welfare.

#ChildrensDay (copy) View on Instagram

National Flag Day

Monday, Jun 14

This celebration dates back to 1777, when the US approved the design for its first national flag. Although it‚Äôs not a federal holiday, Pennsylvania celebrates it as a state holiday.

#FlagDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

World Blood Donor Day

Monday, Jun 14

This day helps to raise awareness for the two most important sides of the blood donor process: the need for safe blood, and a thank you to blood donors for their life-saving gifts.

#GiveBlood (copy) View on Instagram

Details

Fathers Day

Sunday, Jun 20

This day to celebrate the contribution of fathers across the world was first started in the US in the early 20th century. This complement to Mother‚Äôs Day became official in 1972, and has been celebrated every year since.

#FathersDay (copy) View on Instagram

Details

First Day of Summer

Sunday, Jun 20

In 2021, the June solstice occurs on Sunday, June 20, marking the start of summer in the Northern Hemisphere. The exact date and time of the solstice is Sunday, June 20, at 11:32 P.M. EDT.

Details

World Refugee Day

Sunday, Jun 20

This international day was designated by the United Nations to raise awareness about refugees from around the world. It celebrates not only the support they may require, but also the strength and rand courage by the communities affected by global issues.

#WithRefugees (copy) View on Instagram
